title: The Tyrannical beauty. Beauty fadeth like a flower, then fair ladies be not proud, time and sickness may devour, what at present you'r allow'd. To a pleasant tune; called, Prodigious fate.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, I. Clarke, W. Thackeray, and T. Passinger.,
